title: 113_hr1038
content: The "Public Power Risk Management Act of 2013" may be cited as such. Transactions with utility special entities are addressed in the Act. The "Public Power Risk Management Act of 2013" addresses transactions with utility special entities, specifically regarding reporting requirements and exemptions for utility operations-related swaps. The "Public Power Risk Management Act of 2013" defines a utility special entity. The Commodity Exchange Act defines a utility special entity as an entity that owns or operates electric or natural gas facilities, supplies energy to other entities, and has public service obligations under laws or regulations. The Commodity Exchange Act defines a utility special entity as an entity that provides electric energy or natural gas service to customers, or is a Federal power marketing agency. SEC. 4. UTILITY OPERATIONS-RELATED SWAP. The text defines a "utility operations-related swap" as a swap entered into to hedge commercial risks, excluding contracts based on interest rates, credit, equity, or other financial factors. The text defines a "utility operations-related swap" as a swap associated with the generation, production, purchase, or sale of natural gas or electric energy, fuel supply for utility facilities, or compliance with an electric system. The text defines a "utility operations-related swap" as a swap associated with the generation, production, purchase, or sale of natural gas or electric energy, fuel supply for utility facilities, compliance with energy or environmental regulations, or any other energy or gas swap involving a utility. The amendments made by this Act take effect as if enacted on July 21, 2010.
